steps.title: Welcome to terminal.sh
steps.description: terminal.sh is a hacking simulation game. You'll learn to scan networks, exploit vulnerabilities, and mine cryptocurrency.

steps.title: Basic Commands
steps.description:
Try these basic commands:
  - `help` - Show all available commands
  - `userinfo` - View your user information
  - `ifconfig` - View your network configuration
  - `wallet` - Check your wallet balance

steps.title: Scanning the Network
steps.description: Use `scan` to discover servers on the internet. This is your first step to finding targets.

steps.title: Scanning a Server
steps.description: Use `scan <targetIP>` to scan a specific server for services and vulnerabilities. Try scanning one of the servers you found.

steps.title: Getting Tools
steps.description: Tools are essential for exploitation. The 'repo' server contains all available tools. Use `get repo <toolName>` to download tools.

steps.title: Listing Your Tools
steps.description: Use `tools` to see all tools you own. You need to own a tool before you can use it.

steps.title: Exploiting a Server
steps.description: Once you have a tool, you can exploit servers. First, scan a server to see its vulnerabilities, then use the appropriate tool. Example: `password_cracker <targetIP>`

steps.title: SSH Access
steps.description: After successfully exploiting a server, you can SSH into it using `ssh <targetIP>`. This gives you access to the server's filesystem.

tutorials.name: Cryptocurrency Mining
tutorials.description: Learn how to mine cryptocurrency for passive income

steps.title: Getting the Crypto Miner
steps.description: Download the crypto_miner tool from the repo server.

steps.title: Starting a Miner
steps.description: Use `crypto_miner <targetIP>` to start mining on an exploited server. The server must have enough resources (CPU, RAM, bandwidth).

steps.title: Checking Active Miners
steps.description: Use `miners` to see all your active mining sessions. Miners generate cryptocurrency over time.

steps.title: Stopping a Miner
steps.description: Use `stop_mining <targetIP>` to stop a miner when needed.

steps.title: Information Gathering
steps.description: Tools like `user_enum` and `lan_sniffer` help you gather information about servers before exploitation.

steps.title: Multi-Vulnerability Exploitation
steps.description: The `exploit_kit` and `advanced_exploit_kit` tools can exploit multiple vulnerability types at once.

steps.title: Web Exploitation
steps.description: Tools like `sql_injector` and `xss_exploit` target HTTP services specifically.

steps.title: Network Analysis
steps.description: Use `packet_capture` and `packet_decoder` to analyze network traffic.
